scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This collection contains reports, correspondence, news clippings, photographs and other papers from American foreign service officer John Leland Hedges. Hedges spent nearly 40 years as a public diplomat, serving in places such as France, Congo (Brazzaville), Morocco, Lebanon, Thailand, Nigeria, and the Cameroon. He received the Edward R. Murrow Award at the Fletcher School in 1980.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: John Leland Hedges (1927-1987) was an American foreign service diplomat for 37 years. He was recipient of the Edward R. Murrow Award in 1980. A scholarship at the Fletcher School of Law and Diplomancy was named for him after his death.
